intro: Chomelia monachinoi, commonly known as the sacred chomel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling a crown, hence its common name. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species, many of which are known for their medicinal properties. Chomelia monachinoi is typically found in moist, shaded areas and thrives in tropical climates. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, providing a lush backdrop to its vibrant floral display.
